title: Procter & Gamble Says Shoppers Are Unbowed by Higher Prices
sub_head: Quarterly sales rose 6%, led by health and cleaning products, with price increases accounting for half of the jump
body:
Procter & Gamble Co. reported another quarter of strong sales growth as consumers, undeterred by higher prices, loaded up on household staples from Gillette razors to Tide detergent.
The Cincinnati-based consumer-products company reported revenue of $21 billion for the period ended Dec. 31, a 6% increase compared with a year earlier, fueled in part by the companyâ€™s highest average-price increases since spring 2019.
